definition[0]: to leave a place suddenly, especially because you disapprove of something
example[0]: The play was awful and we walked out after half an hour.
example[1]: the issue that led to the US walking out of the trade talks this week
definition[1]: to leave your husband, wife etc suddenly and go and live somewhere else
example[2]: Her husband walked out, leaving her with three children to look after.
example[3]: Five years later she walked out on Matthew and their two boys.
definition[2]: to leave your job suddenly because you no longer want to do it
example[4]: We’re so short-staffed. I can’t just walk out.
example[5]: If you can afford to walk out of your job, why not?
definition[3]: to stop working as a protest
example[6]: Workers are threatening to walk out if an agreement is not reached.
